summary: the middle east respiratory syndrome (MERS) is a new emerging respiratory tract infection caused by a coronavirus. this infection was first reported from Saudi Arabia in the Middle East in 2012. at present, these infections exist in the remote countries away from the middle and raise the concern for the global public health. the patient with respiratory distress has a high chance of mortality and one with underlying disease has a very high risk. it is shown that the patient with respiratory distress has a high chance of mortality and one with underlying disease has a very high risk. the special designed respiratory protector is required for working with a case with MERS. the equipment is usually not available in the many settings where the present emerging disease occurs. there are many respiratory illnesses that can end up with severe respiratory problem. an epidemic of MERS occurs in 2015. the main epidemic site is Korea. the disease is also reported from china and Thailand.
